intro: Notholaena hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its common name. Notholaena hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
